sources.title: A Slave of Love
sources.description:
Civil War. In a seaside southern town occupied by whites, famous movie star Olga Voznesenskaya is acting in new drama named "Slave of Love". The cameraman Victor Pototsky is an underground revolutionary. Victor, risking his life, illegally filmed arrests and executions perpetrated by white counterintelligence. Olga admires his courage. Gradually, this feeling turns into great love...

IMDb rating: 7,2

Year of production: 1976

Director: Nikita Mikhalkov
Writers: Andrey Mikhalkov-Konchalovsky, Friedrich Gorenstein
Composer: Artemyev Eduard
Operator: Lebeshev Pavel
Production Designers: Samulekin Alexander, Adabashyan Alexander

Cast: Alexander Kalyagin, Oleg Basilashvili, Nikita Mikhalkov, Evgeny Steblov, Vera Kuznetsova, Elena Solovey, Nikolai Pastukhov, Rodion Nakhapetov, Inna Ulyanova, Konstantin Grigoriev, Mikhail Chigarev, Alexander Yakovlev, Roninson Gottlieb, Nikolai Yudin

metadata.Plot: Olga Voznesenskaya is a silent screen star whose pictures are so popular that underground revolutionaries risk capture to see them. She's in southern Russia filming a tear-jerker as the Bolsheviks get closer to Moscow. Although married, she spends time every day with Victor Pototsky, the film's cameraman. Gradually, it comes to light that Victor uses his job as a cover for filming White atrocities and Red heroism: he's a Bolshevik. He asks her for help, and she discovers meaning in her otherwise flighty and self-centered life. Love blooms. Will the Red forces arrive in time to save them from a suspicious White military leader? Will she find courage?
metadata.Actors: Elena Solovey, Rodion Nakhapetov, Aleksandr Kalyagin
